comment: Took this class during Summer. There's a group paper + Teams presentation but he gives you a clear outline on how to format both to get an A. Group paper broken up into sections. Exams are lockdown with camera, but it's not hard, mostly definition-based. Quizzes are open book. Just stay on top of your work and you'll get an A. Lots of easy points.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Whole semester was basically 1 group project. Hopefully you're a people person. He's super nice and gives clear feedback on assignments. Easy grader, definitely a good chuck of work. took him over the summer and had something due 4 out of the 5 days of the week. Choose your group wisely!

Brian Rutherford's international Marketing class was fairly easy and straightforward. he could be a bit condescending at times and was strict about presentation timings, but the material was clear and manageable. Overall, I'd take him again and would recommend him if you want a structured, no-nonsense class.

Very easy class in general, and Professor Rutherford knows that. Do the work and you will do good. He is a good teacher pretty easy going. One group project at the end of the semester, he tells you exactly how to get an A.

Rutherford is very condescending when you ask or answer questions during class. Most of his lecture is him waiting for someone to answer the questions that he is supposed to be teaching. Overall the class is easy. There is a group project, but its straightforward. The class is great, the professor is not.

Professor Rutherford was great! His class was very manageable and included a group project. His grading policy was clear and he was upfront about the material on the exams. His lectures were engaging and he encouraged students to participate. Show up for class and you'll have no problem. I would highly recommend this guy for your Marketing 3100!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Rutherford was a nice professor that I'd recommend. There are a lot of small quizzes, 5 exams, and a group project with parts of it due at different times. He tries to get his unit done quickly to leave time for the project presentation, so you have frequent tests and quizzes early in the semester. Overall it's not hard. Tests are webcam

Professor Rutherford is a good teacher. His class consist of discussion post, quizzes, test, and a group project. The group project is broken in sections, throughout the semester. Overall the work is manageable. He is quick to respond to any questions or concerns you might have in the class. definitely take his class if you can.

Great class. There were 3 exams and one was dropped. There were also quizzes due before every class period but they were very easy! One group project but its also very simple if you format it like he wants and have good groupmates. This professor was amazing, so much better than other marketing professor choices.

Class was very straightforward, weekly quizzes and discussion posts.  There are 4 exams including the final, and the lowest grade is dropped.  Study guides are extremely helpful.  He is available for office hours if you have questions.  Group project was not difficult, just make sure you are formatting correctly!  Great professor!

Class was very straightforward, weekly quizzes, and discussion posts.  Make sure you do the reading and participate.  Group project was not difficult.  Make sure you are formatting correctly and you should be fine!  Study guides extremely helpful for exams.  There are 3 exams and a final, lowest grade dropped.  Great professor!

If you need MKTG 3100 as a credit, TAKE HIM!!! He makes the class very easy because he uses a discussion-based class, providing many examples. Each chapter has a 5 super easy question quiz. You have a project that takes a few weeks to complete, but it is a group project. 3 tests and a final, but the lowest grade is dropped.

Took his basic retailing over the summer. Plenty of room for extra credit if you just put forth the effort and try. Loved the fact all the assignments were open! 1 Group Project (10 pages) 30%, mid-term 25%, final 25%, discussions 10% I think 12 with quizzes 10%. Easy A if you apply yourself.

Honestly one of the most chill professors I've ever had. Lectures are interesting and exams aren't too difficult; if you review the textbook definitions and attend review days you will do fine. Group project is a lot of work so get as many people as possible in your group. 

Definitely would take again!

Not a bad professor, but expected to cover a lot of material in a short period. 5 exams including the final that is cumulative. The first 4 exams cover 5 chapters each that can be studied through his PowerPoints. Attendance not mandatory, but recommended for bonus points on exam. One group project with relatively strict guidelines. Take him.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Test heavy

comment: Quiz before every class but SUPER EASY (5 pts each) and open book. 5 tests and drops one (including final) make sure you study! One group project! Finished with an A in April, a month before the end of the semester. TAKE HIM!
rating_tags: Group projects--Get ready to read--Accessible outside class

comment: This professor is a very mid-teacher, to be honest. Nothing too bad nothing too great he definitely has a lot of experience in marketing though. There are three to four tests not that hard I never studied and got a 78  on them. There's a quiz every week that's five questions and open book. The group project is actually pretty easy just long.

Funny professor, really friendly and sassy if you talk to him and show up to class. There is a textbook but it isn't mandatory, just helpful. I haven't used mine but my friend uses hers all the time. Definitely a much better option as a professor versus the other ones I've seen for principles of marketing. Tests in person, not too hard either

Class was really easy but it was a summer class so extremely condensed. He tells you exactly how he wants the group paper written, the tests and quizes are MC and straight from the book. You also have some cases. Overall relatively easy.
